title: Virgil van Dijk ankle injury woe gives Manchester City and Everton transfer jitters
text:
Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments VIRGIL VAN DIJK gave transfer suitors Manchester City and Everton a scare when he was helped off 54 minutes of Southampton’s showdown with Leicester. 
The Dutch central defender, rated at £60million by the Saints, suffered a knock to his ankle from Jamie Vardy after 50 minutes while trying to snub out a Demarai Gray pass. Getty Images Virgil van Dijk leaves the field after 54 minutes against Leicester 
He received attention but was soon back on the pitch. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Southampton news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
But that proved to be a false dawn. 
Two minutes later he dropped to the ground again, clutching his ankle. This time he cannot continue and he has to go off, with Jack Stephens on in his place. 
Missing van Dijk would be a massive blow for Southampton, especially ahead of big games against Liverpool in the League Cup semi-finals and Arsenal in the Premier League this week. Not to mention the attention he is getting from both moneybags City and Everton, managed by van Dijk’s previous manager Ronald Koeman. 
Van Dijk, 25, only signed a new six-year contract with the Saints back in May worth £70,000 a week to become the club’s top earner. Getty Images Van Dijk was hurt attempting to tackle Jamie Vardy Getty Images The central defender fell to the deck clutching his ankle Reuters 4 Extensive treatment failed to keep him on the pitch 
Saints boss Claude Puel has said that the club had no desire to sell the player they bought for £13m from Celtic in 2015.

So far City have bid £50m, which prompted Southampton to place their £60m price tag on their prize asset.
